post_text: Premier High School - Little Rock hosts its first "Teen Talk" on Friday, February 28. The series will provide resources and support for the challenges and misconceptions scholars may face so they can be informed and encouraged in their future choices. #ProvidingHope
shared_text:
Premier High School - Little Rock
February 25 at 9:44 AM ·

Premier Little Rock
PHSLR Teen Talk: This Friday, Feb. 28 we will host the first in a series called Teen Talk. Teen Talk focuses on providing information and resources to our students regarding the challenges or misconceptions that they may face daily. The goal is to provide our students with information/support in hopes that they will become more informed and encouraged about the choices they make. This series is being led and implemented by Ms. Cherry, our new College & Career Coach.

Philander Smith College's 5th Annual African American High School Honor Student Ceremony: Sean Williams, one of our 2020 graduating seniors, was selected and recognized as one of Philander's 5th Annual African American High School Honor Students. In order to qualify students had to have at least a 3.0 GPA as well as be a graduating senior. Sean received a medal, certificate, and even scholarship offers!

Donaghey College of Engineering and Information Technology at Uinversity of Arkansas at Little Rock has several outreach programs during the summer to motivate students (grade 6-12) to pursue Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics, or STEM, degrees.

ResponsiveEd, a non-profit, is located in Lewisville, Texas and operates more than 70 charter schools across Texas and Arkansas. Tiffany Shlain & Let It Ripple Film Studio, thanks for the great resources.

We’re all works in progress. On September 26, 2018, join millions of people around the globe for the fifth annual Character Day — a global initiative where school districts, organizations and families of all sizes screen films on the science of character development from different perspectives, dive into free printed discussion materials catered to different ages, and join an online global conversation around the importance of developing character strengths (resilience, grit, empathy, courage, kindness).
